•	Taking initiatives to build internal tools.
•	Creating and performing authorized changes to customer environments.

OBJECTIVE FOR THIS ROLE

As a Network Engineer at K2 Solutions, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our clients' network infrastructure. You will work closely with a dynamic team of IT professionals to deliver high-quality managed services to our diverse client base. The role involves troubleshooting network issues, optimizing performance, and ensuring the security and reliability of our clients' networks.

•	Collaborate with client stakeholders to identify opportunities for network improvement.
7.	Collaboration with Team:
•	Collaborate with other departments, including systems administrators, security experts, and support staff, to deliver comprehensive solutions.
•	Participate in team meetings and contribute to the overall success of the organization.
8.	Reporting: Technical Team Lead

•	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

•	Hybrid/smart working environment.

Position Summary
RMIT are seeking an experienced Project Coordinator to support ITS portfolio of projects.

As Project Coordinator, your primary responsibility will be to support the ITS team with the implementation and launch of the Global Student Program to successfully coordinate, manage and efficiently deliver this program across RMIT Vietnam, in collaboration with our RMIT AU ITS project team. This will include daily tasks such as status reports, steering group presentations for various forums, financial and risk and issue management, schedules, and administrative support.

An essential element of your role you will ensure that you are well-versed in the Portfolio Office Delivery Framework and Governance processes. This will be achieved by working with the Project team and key roles within the structure to provide advice and guidance on supporting project delivery and process. As part of continuous improvement framework, you will be required to contribute to improvement ideas, call out gaps/inefficiencies, and propose improvement solutions.
Reporting Line
Reports to: Program Manager
Key Accountabilities
Provide program coordination support and oversight across activities relating to the Student Record System project program of work as required,
Oversee and advise on active risk and issue management across portfolio, presentation and reporting activities.
Monitor team resource coordination requirements and escalate any challenges or key issues.
Organise and participate at the resource management engagements, whereby resource requirements are prioritised in alignment with the priority tasks.
Maintain project SharePoint site, artefacts, ensuring appropriate storage and governance.
Onboard and support new team members within the team including organising assets and onboarding activities.
Work collaboratively with the project communications team to post or share communications via relevant channels as required (SharePoint, email, yammer, website etc.)
Support the program leadership team in planning activities, ensuring schedules are being maintained and deliverables, milestones and dependencies are incorporated.
Provide administration support to the program activities: project governance forums, stand ups, stakeholder updates, meetings schedule
Coordinate to create and maintain project documentation, plans and reports as well as appropriate paperwork
Yêu cầu công việc: Key Selection Criteria
At least 3 years of relevant experience as a program/portfolio coordinator with a background and experience working in a technology environment.
Outstanding levels of productivity in terms of attention to details, time management, prioritisation, and speed.
The ability to work autonomously by meeting deadlines, managing priorities and agility to be able to adapt to flexible timeframes.
Team player with a strong customer service focus. Well-developed interpersonal skills, including coordination, liaison, negotiation, and multicultural communication.
Keen attention to detail with ability to manage own time well, and prioritise competing work demands, effectively.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Vietnamese with a wide variety of stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work with confidential information
Demonstrated superior knowledge and experience in using computer software such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Access.
Bachelor’s degree in Technology (or a related discipline)
Certification in Prince2 or PMI preferable but not essential
English Proficiency

English is the language of teaching and communication at RMIT Vietnam. For this role, the minimum requirement is IELTS General with a score of at least 6.0 (or equivalent, as outlined in the Recruitment, Selection and Onboarding Guidelines).

For any role, English Language Proficiency may also be proven by showing successful completion of secondary education to a level qualifying to enter university study while being instructed through the medium of English, as per the RMIT University recognised qualification list.
